I am the 2022 McKenzie Postdoctoral Research Fellow at <a href="https://fbe.unimelb.edu.au/economics" target="_blank">the Department of Economics at the University of Melbourne</a>. In 2026 I will be joining <a href="https://crest.science" target="_blank">CREST</a> in Paris as <a href="https://www.cnrs.fr/en" target="_blank">CNRS</a> Research Fellow. \ 

I am an economist interested in **applied microeconomics**, **applied econometrics** and the formation of **human capital**. I study how childrenâ€™s health and education is shaped by their parents, teachers, peers, and education and welfare policies. I am also interested in meta-science and methods to improve the reliability of our empirical research findings. My McKenzie Fellowship project focuses on methods to synthesize and generalize empirical findings in the case of peer effects and teacher role model effects on student performance.\

## Education

I completed my Ph.D. in Economics from Maastricht University in the Netherlands in 2021 under the supervision of <a href="https://sites.google.com/site/oliviermarie/" target="_blank">Prof. Olivier Marie</a>. After my Ph.D., I joined the University of Sydney in Australia as postdoctoral Research Associate, before joining the University of Melbourne in my current capacity. Before my Ph.D., I completed a M.Sc. degree in Statistics at <a href="http://ensai.fr/en/" target="_blank">Ensai</a> in France, and a M.Sc. in Economics at <a href="https://www.wiwi.hu-berlin.de/en/mainpage" target="_blank">Humboldt University</a> in Germany.\
